item.title: My New Page
item.description:
My research interests include the political economy of communication & media, critical communication research, digital labor & gig worker, platform economy, algorithmic management, human-computer/AI interaction, algorithmic fairness, accountability, transparency, and ethics (FATE), mixed methods research.

ðŸŽ‰ I received the 2023 Dallas Smythe Award at IAMCR for the project titled “Digital Capital Never Sleeps: An Empirical Study of Digital Labor and Manufacturing Consent in China”. It is under revision and expected to be submitted to Capital & Class very soon.

Email: tianyangfu@utexas.edu
Personal Website: tianyangfu.github.io

Many thanks for your interest ðŸ–¤

Education

The University of Texas at Austin (UT Austin)
Ph.D. in Communication Studies, Organizational Communication & Technology
Graduate Portfolio Program in Ethical AI
The University of Chicago
M.A. in Social Sciences, concentration on Sociology
Thesis Advisor: Dr. Andreas Glaeser
Beijing Foreign Studies University (BFSU)
B.A. in Journalism, concentration on Intercultural Communication
Minor: International Economics & Trade
Thesis Advisor: Dr. Fei Jiang (University of Chinese Academy of Social Sciences)
The University of Edinburgh
Study Abroad

Aside from research, I enjoy teaching and tutoring students with subjects across disciplines as a Teaching Assistant or Assistant Instructor. Selected teaching experiences include:

At the University of Texas at Austin:

  • CMS 372T Time Matters (Prof. Dawna Ballard)

All other institutions:

  • Exploring the Worldâ€™s Religions (Prof. Matthew J. Pereira)
  • Gender, Sexuality & Society (Prof. Jordan Shapiro)
  • Introduction to Philosophy (Prof. Tiffany Traylor)
  • Introduction to Sociology (Dr. Jialin Li)
  • Media and Advertisement (Prof. Judith Ainsworth)
  • The Emergence of the Modern World (Prof. Heidi Morrison)
  • World History (Prof. Heidi Morrison)
